info.title: Google Sites
info.description: The Google Sites API allows client applications to access, publish, and modify content within a Google Site.

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: site or the domain of your Google Apps hosted domain (e.g. example.com).

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: Specifies a version number.

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: The webspace name of your site; found in the Sites URL (e.g. myCoolSite).

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Specifies Content Type.

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: site or the domain of your Google Apps hosted domain (e.g. example.com).

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: Specifies a version number.

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: The webspace name of your site; found in the Sites URL (e.g. myCoolSite).

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: site or the domain of your Google Apps hosted domain (e.g. example.com).

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: Specifies a version number.

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: The webspace name of your site; found in the Sites URL (e.g. myCoolSite).

parameters.name: user_mail
parameters.description: User mail. Example: new_writer%40example.com.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Specifies Content Type.

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: site or the domain of your Google Apps hosted domain (e.g. example.com).

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: Specifies a version number.

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: The webspace name of your site; found in the Sites URL (e.g. myCoolSite).

parameters.name: user_mail
parameters.description: User mail. Example: new_writer%40example.com.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Entry author. The service returns entries where the author name and/or email address match your query string.

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: site or the domain of your Google Apps hosted domain (e.g. example.com).

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: Specifies a version number.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to be retrieved. By default the API will return the first 100 documents and files in the users resource list. To request more or less than 100 resources, use the max-results GET parameter with any resources feed URL. Valid values for this parameter are integers from 1 to 1000, inclusive.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Full-text query string. When creating a query, list search terms separated by spaces, in the form q=term1 term2 term3. (As with all of the query parameter values, the spaces must be URL encoded.) The service returns all entries that match all of the search terms (like using AND between terms). Like Googles web search, a service searches on complete words (and related words with the same stem), not substrings.To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks: q=exact phrase.To

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: The webspace name of your site; found in the Sites URL (e.g. myCoolSite).

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: 1-based index of the first result to be retrieved. Note that this isnt a general cursoring mechanism. If you first send a query with ?start-index=1&max-results=10 and then send another query with ?start-index=11&max-results=10, the service cannot guarantee that the results are equivalent to ?start-index=1&max-results=20, because insertions and deletions could have taken place in between the two queries.

parameters.name: updated-max
parameters.description: Bound on the entry update date. Use the RFC 3339 timestamp format. For example: 2005-08-09T10:57:00-08:00. The lower bound is inclusive, whereas the upper bound is exclusive. In some cases (such as when using v2.1 or newer of the Calendar Data API), specifying an updated-min that is too far in the past will cause an HTTP 410 (Gone) status to be returned.

parameters.name: updated-min
parameters.description: Bound on the entry update date. Use the RFC 3339 timestamp format. For example: 2005-08-09T10:57:00-08:00. The lower bound is inclusive, whereas the upper bound is exclusive. In some cases (such as when using v2.1 or newer of the Calendar Data API), specifying an updated-min that is too far in the past will cause an HTTP 410 (Gone) status to be returned.

parameters.name: activityEntryID
parameters.description: Specifies Activity Entry ID.}

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: site or the domain of your Google Apps hosted domain (e.g. example.com).

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: Specifies a version number.

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: The webspace name of your site; found in the Sites URL (e.g. myCoolSite).

get.summary: Get a Revision for Content Entry
get.description: Get a Revision for Content Entry

parameters.name: ancestor
parameters.description: Requests only entries that have the specified ancestor. Provide the ID of the desired ancestor entry. For example: 0123456789. Returns all entries that have the specified ancestor as a parent, a parents parent, and so on.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Entry author. The service returns entries where the author name and/or email address match your query string.

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: site or the domain of your Google Apps hosted domain (e.g. example.com).

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: Specifies a version number.

parameters.name: include-deleted
parameters.description: Specifies whether to include deleted entries. Possible values are true or false. Default is false.

parameters.name: include-draft
parameters.description: Specifies whether to include draft entries. Possible values are true or false. Default is false. You need to be the owner or author of the draft to view it.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: Specifies the kind(s) of content entries to return. These follow the type of page within Google Sites.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to be retrieved. By default the API will return the first 100 documents and files in the users resource list. To request more or less than 100 resources, use the max-results GET parameter with any resources feed URL. Valid values for this parameter are integers from 1 to 1000, inclusive.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: Requests only entries that have the specified parent. Provide the ID of the parent entry. For example: 0123456789.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Requests content under a certain page hierarchy. The path to a subpage within a Site to fetch content for. For example: path=/path/to/page.

parameters.name: published-max
parameters.description: Bound on the entry publication date. Use the RFC 3339 timestamp format. For example: 2005-08-09T10:57:00-08:00. The lower bound is inclusive, whereas the upper bound is exclusive.

parameters.name: published-min
parameters.description: Bound on the entry publication date. Use the RFC 3339 timestamp format. For example: 2005-08-09T10:57:00-08:00. The lower bound is inclusive, whereas the upper bound is exclusive.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Full-text query string. When creating a query, list search terms separated by spaces, in the form q=term1 term2 term3. (As with all of the query parameter values, the spaces must be URL encoded.) The service returns all entries that match all of the search terms (like using AND between terms). Like Googles web search, a service searches on complete words (and related words with the same stem), not substrings.To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks: q=exact phrase.To

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: The webspace name of your site; found in the Sites URL (e.g. myCoolSite).

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: 1-based index of the first result to be retrieved. Note that this isnt a general cursoring mechanism. If you first send a query with ?start-index=1&max-results=10 and then send another query with ?start-index=11&max-results=10, the service cannot guarantee that the results are equivalent to ?start-index=1&max-results=20, because insertions and deletions could have taken place in between the two queries.

parameters.name: updated-max
parameters.description: Bound on the entry update date. Use the RFC 3339 timestamp format. For example: 2005-08-09T10:57:00-08:00. The lower bound is inclusive, whereas the upper bound is exclusive. In some cases (such as when using v2.1 or newer of the Calendar Data API), specifying an updated-min that is too far in the past will cause an HTTP 410 (Gone) status to be returned.

parameters.name: updated-min
parameters.description: Bound on the entry update date. Use the RFC 3339 timestamp format. For example: 2005-08-09T10:57:00-08:00. The lower bound is inclusive, whereas the upper bound is exclusive. In some cases (such as when using v2.1 or newer of the Calendar Data API), specifying an updated-min that is too far in the past will cause an HTTP 410 (Gone) status to be returned.

parameters.description: Specifies Content Entry ID.

parameters.description: site or the domain of your Google Apps hosted domain (e.g. example.com).

parameters.description: Specifies a version number.

parameters.description: Specifies an Revision Entry ID.

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: site or the domain of your Google Apps hosted domain (e.g. example.com).

parameters.name: GData-Version
parameters.description: Specifies a version number.

parameters.name: include-all-sites
parameters.description: List all sites that can be at least viewed by the user in the Google Apps domain. This parameter is only applicable when listing sites for a Google Apps domain. Possible values are true or false. Default is false.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to be retrieved. By default the API will return the first 100 documents and files in the users resource list. To request more or less than 100 resources, use the max-results GET parameter with any resources feed URL. Valid values for this parameter are integers from 1 to 1000, inclusive.

Like Googles web search, a service searches on complete words (and related words with the same stem), not substrings.To search for an exact phrase, enclose the phrase in quotation marks: q=exact phrase.To

parameters.name: start-index
parameters.description: 1-based index of the first result to be retrieved. Note that this isnt a general cursoring mechanism. If you first send a query with ?start-index=1&max-results=10 and then send another query with ?start-index=11&max-results=10, the service cannot guarantee that the results are equivalent to ?start-index=1&max-results=20, because insertions and deletions could have taken place in between the two queries.

parameters.name: updated-max
parameters.description: Bound on the entry update date. Use the RFC 3339 timestamp format. For example: 2005-08-09T10:57:00-08:00. The lower bound is inclusive, whereas the upper bound is exclusive. In some cases (such as when using v2.1 or newer of the Calendar Data API), specifying an updated-min that is too far in the past will cause an HTTP 410 (Gone) status to be returned.

parameters.name: updated-min
parameters.description: Bound on the entry update date. Use the RFC 3339 timestamp format. For example: 2005-08-09T10:57:00-08:00. The lower bound is inclusive, whereas the upper bound is exclusive. In some cases (such as when using v2.1 or newer of the Calendar Data API), specifying an updated-min that is too far in the past will cause an HTTP 410 (Gone) status to be returned.

parameters.name: with-mappings
parameters.description: Includes the web address mappings in a site entry. Possible values are true or false. Default is false.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Entry author. The service returns entries where the author name and/or email address match your query string.
